intro: Desbordesia pallida, commonly known as the pale desbordesia, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, pale pink to white flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Desbordesia pallida is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
